definition: Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
far-flung realms as next door (idiom)/close in spirit although far away
see 天涯若比鄰|天涯若比邻[tian1 ya2 ruo4 bi3 lin2]
close friend in a distant land, far-flung realms as next door/close in spirit although far away
pinyin: hai3 nei4 cun2 zhi1 ji3 , tian1 ya2 ruo4 bi3 lin2
containing_words.word: 海内存知己，天涯若比邻

sentences.english: But today in our cities and suburbs, neighboring is not common.
sentences.chinese: 但如今在市区或者市郊，比邻而居并不常见。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, relations of the Qin with the "Man Yi"(Barbarian) are reviewed.
sentences.chinese: 同时探讨了“秦人”与比邻“蛮夷”的关系。

sentences.english: Arti sans' stalls and palaces stand side by side.
sentences.chinese: 工匠们的店铺与宫殿比邻共存。

sentences.english: Tianjin is Beijing's neighboring harbor city, two hours away by bus.
sentences.chinese: 天津是和北京比邻的海港城市，坐汽车两个小时。

sentences.english: With the area of neighbors, fast iron direct, 1 hours to Chengdu circle.
sentences.chinese: 与景区比邻而居，快铁直达，1小时大成都圈。

sentences.english: K.Rowling when she sits next to her at a pre-summit dinner.
sentences.chinese: 罗琳会面，两人在峰会召开前的一个晚宴上比邻而坐。

definition: to be right next to/close neighbor
to look at one another/to face each other
to be located at/to be situated in
to be right next to/to lean closely against
to be situated/to be located (of a building)
to be situated/located at (of building)/also written 坐落[zuo4 luo4]
